method.name: GET
method.doc: Creates a new event. See http://eventful.com/events/new for an example interface.

param.name: title
param.doc: The event title.

param.name: start_time
param.doc: The event start time in ISO 8601 format (e.g. "2005-03-01T19:00:00") or a readable alternative (e.g. "2005-03-01 19:00:00"). See the W3C Note on Date and Time formats for examples or RFC3339 for more detail. Note that if offset information is specified here (e.g. "2005-03-01T19:00:00-04:00"), the time will be converted to UTC. The preferred method of specifying the time zone is via the tz_olson_path parameter.

param.name: stop_time
param.doc: The event stop time, if any, in ISO 8601 format. Optional.

param.name: tz_olson_path
param.doc: The event timezone, as listed in the Olson timezones database (e.g. "America/New_York"). Optional.

param.name: all_day
param.doc: True ("1") if the event is an all-day event, false ("0") otherwise. Optional.

param.name: description
param.doc: The event description. Optional.

param.name: privacy
param.doc: The privacy setting for this event. (1 = public, 2 = private, 3 = semi-private) Optional, defaults to 1.

param.name: tags
param.doc: A space-delimited list of tags. Optional.

param.name: free
param.doc: True ("1") if the event is free, false ("0") otherwise. Optional.

param.name: price
param.doc: A text string describing the event price. For example, this could indicate a price range ("$15 - $35"), free but donations requested ("$10 donation suggested"), or other special instructions ("Adults $15, children under eight $5"). Don't pass this parameter or leave it blank if there is no price information. Optional.

param.name: venue_id
param.doc: The ID of the venue where this event occurs. Use /venues/new or /venues/search retrieve an appropriate ID. Optional.

param.name: parent_id
param.doc: The ID of this event's parent event. Optional.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Given an event ID, returns the event data associated with that event. See http://eventful.com/events/E0-001-000278174-6 for an example interface.

param.name: id
param.doc: The ID of the requested event.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Modifies an existing event.

param.name: id
param.doc: The ID of the event to modify. Optional.

param.name: title
param.doc: The event title. Optional.

param.name: start_time
param.doc: The event start time in ISO 8601 format (e.g. "2005-03-01T19:00:00") or a readable alternative (e.g. "2005-03-01 19:00:00"). See the W3C Note on Date and Time formats for examples or RFC3339 for more detail. Note that if offset information is specified here (e.g. "2005-03-01T19:00:00-04:00"), the time will be converted to UTC. The preferred method of specifying the time zone is via the tz_olson_path parameter. Optional.

param.name: stop_time
param.doc: The event stop time, if any, in ISO 8601 format. Optional.

param.name: tz_olson_path
param.doc: The event timezone, as listed in the Olson timezones database (e.g. "America/New_York"). Optional.

param.name: all_day
param.doc: True ("1") if the event is an all-day event, false ("0") otherwise. Optional.

param.name: description
param.doc: The event description. Optional.

param.name: privacy
param.doc: The privacy setting for this event. (1 = public, 2 = private, 3 = semi-private) Optional, defaults to 1.

param.name: tags
param.doc: A space-delimited list of tags. Optional.

param.name: free
param.doc: True ("1") if the event is free, false ("0") otherwise. Optional.

param.name: price
param.doc: A text string describing the event price. For example, this could indicate a price range ("$15 - $35"), free but donations requested ("$10 donation suggested"), or other special instructions ("Adults $15, children under eight $5"). Don't pass this parameter or leave it blank if there is no price information. Optional.

param.name: venue_id
param.doc: The ID of the venue where this event occurs. Use /venues/modify or /venues/search retrieve an appropriate ID. Optional.

param.name: parent_id
param.doc: The ID of this event's parent event. Optional.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Given an event ID, sets the event record to be withdrawn. Withdrawn events no longer show up in search results.

param.name: id
param.doc: The id of the event to withdraw.

param.name: note
param.doc: An optional note describing why the event has been withdrawn.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Given an ID of a currently-withdrawn event, restores the event record to active status.

param.name: id
param.doc: The id of the event to restore.

method.name: GET
method.doc: This function handles event search. It performs the requested search, returning the results as an XML file. See the search box at http://eventful.com/events for an example interface.

param.name: keywords
param.doc: The search keywords. Optional.

param.name: location
param.doc: A location name to use in filtering the search results. Locations in the form "San Diego", "San Diego, TX", "London, United Kingdom", and "Calgary, Alberta, Canada" are accepted, as are postal codes ("92122") and venue IDs ("V0-001-000268633-5"). Common geocoordinate formats ("32.746682, -117.162741") are also accepted, but the "within" parameter is recommended in order to set a search radius. Optional.

param.name: date
param.doc: Limit this list of results to a date range, specified by label or exact range. Currently supported labels include: "All", "Future", "Past", "Today", "Last Week", "This Week", "Next week", and months by name, e.g. "October". Exact ranges take the form 'YYYYMMDDHH-YYYYMMDDHH', e.g. '2008042500-2008042723'. Optional.

param.name: category
param.doc: Limit the search results to this category ID. See /categories/list for a list of categories and their IDs. Optional.

param.name: within
param.doc: If within is set and the "location" parameter resolves to a specific geolocation, the search will be restricted to the specified radius. If the "location" parameter does not resolve to a specific location, this parameter is ignored. Optional.

param.name: units
param.doc: One of "mi" or "km", the units of the "within" parameter. Defaults to "mi". Optional.

param.name: count_only
param.doc: If count_only is set, an abbreviated version of the output will be returned. Only total_items and search_time elements are included in the result. Optional.

param.name: sort_order
param.doc: One of 'popularity', 'date', or 'relevance'. Default is 'relevance'. Optional.

param.name: sort_direction
param.doc: One of 'ascending' or 'descending'. Default varies by sort_order. Optional.

param.name: page_size
param.doc: The desired number of results per page. Optional.

param.name: page_number
param.doc: The desired page number. Optional.

param.name: mature
param.doc: Sets the level of filtering for events marked as "mature" due to keywords in the title or description. One of 'all' (no filtering), 'normal', or 'safe'. 'Normal' mature filtering consists of words that are clearly profanities and inappropriate for younger audiences. 'Safe' mature filtering consists of all normal mature filtered words, as well as other terms that may be used as inappropriate innuendo. A 'safe' filter may eliminate events that are benign in nature, but contain questionable content based on keywords. Defaults to 'all'. Optional.

param.name: include
param.doc: Indicates that optional sections should be included in the result XML. Multiple section names can be indicated, separated by commas (e.g. 'categories,links'). Sections include 'categories', 'price', and 'links'. Optional.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Given an event ID, updates the search index for that event. Ordinarily, the Eventful search index is updated to reflect recent changes automatically every few minutes. In some cases it's preferred to make a specific change searchable immediately. This is the method to use in that case.

param.name: id
param.doc: The id of the event to reindex.

method.name: GET
method.doc: This function handles event search and returns the results in an iCalendar (RFC-2445) format, not in XML.

param.name: keywords
param.doc: The search keywords. Optional.

param.name: location
param.doc: A location name to use in filtering the search results. Locations in the form "San Diego", "San Diego, TX", "London, United Kingdom", and "Calgary, Alberta, Canada" are accepted, as are postal codes ("92122"). Full addresses ("1 Infinite Loop, Cupertino, CA") and common geocoordinate formats ("32.746682, -117.162741") are also accepted, but the "within" parameter is recommended in order to set a search radius. Optional.

param.name: date
param.doc: Limit this list of results to the specified date range. Date ranges are specified by label. Currently supported labels include: "All", "Future", "Past", "Today", "Last Week", "This Week", "Next week", and months by name, e.g. "October". Optional.

param.name: within
param.doc: Limit this list of results to the specified date range. Date ranges are specified by label. Currently supported labels include: "All", "Future", "Past", "Today", "Last Week", "This Week", "Next week", and months by name, e.g. "October". Optional.

param.name: units
param.doc: One of "mi" or "km", the units of the "within" parameter. Defaults to "mi". Optional.

param.name: sort_order
param.doc: One of 'popularity', 'date', 'title', 'relevance', or 'venue_name'. Default is 'date'. Optional.

param.name: sort_direction
param.doc: One of 'ascending' or 'descending'. Default varies by sort_order. Optional.

param.name: page_size
param.doc: The desired number of results per page. Default: 50, Maximum: 50. Optional.

method.name: GET
method.doc: This function handles event search and returns the results in an RSS 2.0 (Specification) XML format.

param.name: keywords
param.doc: The search keywords. Optional.

param.name: location
param.doc: A location name to use in filtering the search results. Locations in the form "San Diego", "San Diego, TX", "London, United Kingdom", and "Calgary, Alberta, Canada" are accepted, as are postal codes ("92122"). Full addresses ("1 Infinite Loop, Cupertino, CA") and common geocoordinate formats ("32.746682, -117.162741") are also accepted, but the "within" parameter is recommended in order to set a search radius. Optional.

param.name: date
param.doc: Limit this list of results to the specified date range. Date ranges are specified by label. Currently supported labels include: "All", "Future", "Past", "Today", "Last Week", "This Week", "Next week", and months by name, e.g. "October". Optional.

param.name: within
param.doc: Limit this list of results to the specified date range. Date ranges are specified by label. Currently supported labels include: "All", "Future", "Past", "Today", "Last Week", "This Week", "Next week", and months by name, e.g. "October". Optional.

param.name: units
param.doc: One of "mi" or "km", the units of the "within" parameter. Defaults to "mi". Optional.

param.name: sort_order
param.doc: One of 'popularity', 'date', 'title', 'relevance', or 'venue_name'. Default is 'date'. Optional.

param.name: sort_direction
param.doc: One of 'ascending' or 'descending'. Default varies by sort_order. Optional.

param.name: page_size
param.doc: The desired number of results per page. Default: 50, Maximum: 50. Optional.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Lists all tags attached to an event.

param.name: id
param.doc: The ID of the event.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Lists all users going attached to an event.

param.name: id
param.doc: The ID of the event.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Adds a new tag to an event.

param.name: tags
param.doc: A space-delimited list of tags. Tags with spaces should be enclosed in quotes (e.g. "San Diego").

param.name: id
param.doc: The ID of the event to which these tags are being added.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Removes tags from an event.

param.name: tags
param.doc: A space-delimited list of tags. Tags with spaces should be enclosed in quotes (e.g. "San Diego").

param.name: id
param.doc: The ID of the event from which these tags are being removed.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Adds a new comment to an event. See http://eventful.com/events/E0-001-000278174-6 for an example interface.

param.name: id
param.doc: The ID of the event to which this comment is being added.

param.name: comments
param.doc: The body of the comment message.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Modifies the text of a comment attached to an event. See http://eventful.com/events/E0-001-000278174-6 for an example interface.

param.name: comment_id
param.doc: The ID of the comment to modify.

param.name: comments
param.doc: The new, modified comment to save.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Deletes a comment from an event. See http://eventful.com/events/E0-001-000278174-6 for an example interface.

param.name: comment_id
param.doc: The ID of the comment to be deleted.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Adds a new link to an event. See http://eventful.com/events/E0-001-000278174-6 for an example interface.

param.name: id
param.doc: The ID of the event to which this link is being added.

param.name: link
param.doc: The URL of the link. (e.g. "http://foo.com")

param.name: description
param.doc: The title of the link. (e.g. "Foo Laboratories"). Optional.

param.name: link_type_id
param.doc: The ID of the link type. See API docs for accepted values.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Deletes a link from an event. See http://eventful.com/events/E0-001-000278174-6 for an example interface.

param.name: id
param.doc: The ID of the event from which this link is being removed.

param.name: link_id
param.doc: The ID of the link to be deleted.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Deletes a images from an event. See http://eventful.com/events/E0-001-000278174-6 for an example interface.

param.name: id
param.doc: The event ID.

param.name: images_id
param.doc: The image ID. (See /images/new to upload an image and retrieve the ID.)

method.name: GET
method.doc: Removes an image from an event.

param.name: id
param.doc: The event ID.

param.name: images_id
param.doc: The image ID. (See /images/new to upload an image and retrieve the ID.)

method.name: GET
method.doc: Adds a performer to an event.

param.name: id
param.doc: The event ID.

param.name: performer_id
param.doc: The performer ID. (See /performers/new to create a performer and retrieve the ID.)

method.name: GET
method.doc: Removes a performer from an event.

param.name: id
param.doc: The event ID.

param.name: performer_id
param.doc: The performer ID. (See /events/get to list the performer IDs for an event.)

method.name: GET
method.doc: Adds a property to an event. Properties are custom name/value pairs that can be used to add arbitrary information to an event. For instance, a "Rating" property of "5 Stars" could be added to an event using this method.

param.name: id
param.doc: The event ID.

param.name: name
param.doc: The property name.

param.name: value
param.doc: The property value.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Lists all properties for an event.

param.name: id
param.doc: The event ID.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Removes a property (or group of properties) from an event.

param.name: id
param.doc: The event ID.

param.name: property_id
param.doc: The ID of the property to remove. Specify either this or "name".

param.name: name
param.doc: The name of the property to remove. NOTE: if name is specified, any property with this name will be removed from this event. Specify either this or "id".

method.name: GET
method.doc: Adds a event to the speficied category.

param.name: id
param.doc: The event ID.

param.name: category_id
param.doc: The category ID. (See /categories/list for a list of available categories.)

method.name: GET
method.doc: Removes a event from the speficied category.

param.name: id
param.doc: The event ID.

param.name: category_id
param.doc: The category ID. (See /categories/list for a list of available categories.)

method.name: GET
method.doc: Given a date string in most common formats, return a start_date and end_date in ISO 8601 format, suitable for /events/new. Uses the current date to make assumptions about relative dates. For example, the where string "Feb 15 8pm-10pm", submitted in January 2007, would resolve to a start_date of "2007-02-15T20:00:00" and an end_date of "2007-02-15T22:00:00". Dates without times are assumed to be all-day events, so "February 27th" would resolve to a start_date of "2007-02-27T00:00:00" with the all_day flag set to 1.

param.name: when
param.doc: A string containing a date and optional time(s).

method.name: GET
method.doc: Creates a new venue with the provided information. See http://eventful.com/venues/new for an example interface.

param.name: name
param.doc: The displayed name for this venue.

param.name: address
param.doc: The street address of the venue. Optional.

param.name: city
param.doc: The city name. Optional.

param.name: region
param.doc: The name of the region (state, province, county). Optional.

param.name: postal_code
param.doc: The postal code or ZIP code. Optional.

param.name: country
param.doc: The name of the country.

param.name: description
param.doc: The venue description. Optional.

param.name: privacy
param.doc: The privacy setting for this venue. (1 = public, 2 = private, 3 = semi-private). Optional, defaults to 1.

param.name: venue_type
param.doc: The type of venue (e.g. Cinema, Arena). See eventful.com/venues/new for a current list of options.

param.name: url
param.doc: A URI link to further information about this venue. Optional.

param.name: url_type
param.doc: The type of the link provided in the url parameter (e.g. Blog, Review, Official Site). See the "Add a link" section of any event page for a current list. Optional.

param.name: parent_id
param.doc: The ID of this venue's parent venue. Optional.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Given a venue ID, returns information about that particular venue.

param.name: id
param.doc: The ID of the requested venue.

param.name: mature
param.doc: Sets the level of filtering for events marked as "mature" due to keywords in the title or description. One of 'all' (no filtering), 'normal', or 'safe'. 'Normal' mature filtering consists of words that are clearly profanities and inappropriate for younger audiences. 'Safe' mature filtering consists of all normal mature filtered words, as well as other terms that may be used as inappropriate innuendo. A 'safe' filter may eliminate events that are benign in nature, but contain questionable content based on keywords. Defaults to 'all'.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Creates a modify venue with the provided information. See http://eventful.com/venues/modify for an example interface.

param.name: id
param.doc: The ID of the venue to modify.

param.name: name
param.doc: The displayed name for this venue. Optional.

param.name: address
param.doc: The street address of the venue. Optional.

param.name: city
param.doc: The city name. Optional.

param.name: region
param.doc: The name of the region (state, province, county). Optional.

param.name: postal_code
param.doc: The postal code or ZIP code. Optional.

param.name: country
param.doc: The name of the country. Optional.

param.name: description
param.doc: The venue description. Optional.

param.name: privacy
param.doc: The privacy setting for this venue. (1 = public, 2 = private, 3 = semi-private). Optional, defaults to 1.

param.name: venue_type
param.doc: The type of venue (e.g. Cinema, Arena). See eventful.com/venues/modify for a current list of options. Optional.

param.name: url
param.doc: A URI link to further information about this venue. Optional.

param.name: url_type
param.doc: The type of the link provided in the url parameter (e.g. Blog, Review, Official Site). See the "Add a link" section of any event page for a current list. Optional.

param.name: parent_id
param.doc: The ID of this venue's parent venue. Optional.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Given a venue ID, sets the venue record to be withdrawn. Withdrawn venues no longer show up in search results. Please note that events attached to venue will not be withdrawn and will still link to the venue.

param.name: id
param.doc: The ID of the requested venue.

param.name: note
param.doc: An optional note describing why the venue has been withdrawn.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Given an ID of a currently-withdrawn venue, restores the venue record to active status.

param.name: id
param.doc: The ID of the requested venue.

method.name: GET
method.doc: This function handles venue search. It performs the requested search, returning the results as an XML file.

param.name: keywords
param.doc: The search keywords. Optional.

param.name: location
param.doc: A location name to use in filtering the search results. Locations in the form "San Diego", "San Diego, TX", "London, United Kingdom", and "Calgary, Alberta, Canada" are accepted, as are postal codes ("92122") and venue IDs ("V0-001-000268633-5"). Common geocoordinate formats ("32.746682, -117.162741") are also accepted, but the "within" parameter is recommended in order to set a search radius. Optional.

param.name: count_only
param.doc: If count_only is set, an abbreviated version of the output will be returned. Only total_items and search_time elements are included in the result. Optional.

param.name: page_size
param.doc: The desired number of results per page. Optional.

param.name: page_number
param.doc: The desired page number. Optional.

param.name: within
param.doc: If within is set and the "location" parameter resolves to a specific geolocation, the search will be restricted to the specified radius. If the "location" parameter does not resolve to a specific location, this parameter is ignored. Optional.

param.name: units
param.doc: One of "mi" or "km", the units of the "within" parameter. Defaults to "mi". Optional.

param.name: sort_order
param.doc: One of 'popularity', 'date', or 'relevance'. Default is 'relevance'. Optional.

param.name: sort_direction
param.doc: One of 'ascending' or 'descending'. Default varies by sort_order. Optional.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Lists all tags attached to a venue.

param.name: id
param.doc: The ID of the venue.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Adds a new tag to an event.

param.name: tags
param.doc: A space-delimited list of tags. Tags with spaces should be enclosed in quotes (e.g. "San Diego").

param.name: id
param.doc: The ID of the venue to which these tags are being added.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Removes tags from an venue.

param.name: tags
param.doc: A space-delimited list of tags. Tags with spaces should be enclosed in quotes (e.g. "San Diego").

param.name: id
param.doc: The ID of the venue from which these tags are being removed.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns an iCalendar (RFC-2445) (not XML) document of events occuring at a specified venue.

param.name: id
param.doc: The ID of the venue to use as the feed source.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns an RSS 2.0 (Specification) feed of events occuring at a specified venue.

param.name: id
param.doc: The ID of the venue to use as the feed source.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Adds a new comment to a venue. See http://eventful.com/venues/V0-001-000111066-8 for an example interface.

param.name: id
param.doc: The ID of the venue to which this comment is being added.

param.name: comments
param.doc: The body of the comment message.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Modifies the text of a comment attached to an venue. See http://eventful.com/venues/V0-001-000111066-8 for an example interface.

param.name: comment_id
param.doc: The ID of the comment to modify.

param.name: comments
param.doc: The new, modified comment to save.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Deletes a comment from an venue. See http://eventful.com/venues/V0-001-000111066-8 for an example interface.

param.name: comment_id
param.doc: The ID of the comment to be deleted.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Adds a new link to a venue. See http://eventful.com/venues/V0-001-000102695-2 for an example interface.

param.name: id
param.doc: The ID of the event to which this link is being added.

param.name: link
param.doc: The URL of the link. (e.g. "http://foo.com")

param.name: description
param.doc: The title of the link. (e.g. "Foo Laboratories"). Optional.

param.name: link_type_id
param.doc: The ID of the link type. See API docs for accepted values.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Deletes a link from a venue. See http://eventful.com/venues/V0-001-000102695-2 for an example interface.

param.name: id
param.doc: The ID of the venue from which this link is being removed.

param.name: link_id
param.doc: The ID of the link to be deleted.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Adds a property to a venue. Properties are custom name/value pairs that can be used to add arbitrary information to a venue. For instance, a "Rating" property of "5 Stars" could be added to a venue using this method.

param.name: id
param.doc: The venue ID.

param.name: name
param.doc: The property name.

param.name: value
param.doc: The property value.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Lists all properties for a venue.

param.name: id
param.doc: The venue ID.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Removes a property (or group of properties) from a venue.

param.name: id
param.doc: The venue ID.

param.name: property_id
param.doc: The ID of the property to remove. Specify either this or "name".

param.name: name
param.doc: The name of the property to remove. NOTE: if name is specified, any property with this name will be removed from this venue. Specify either this or "id".

method.name: GET
method.doc: Given a location string, return a venue ID suitable for /events/new if possible. This method searches through Eventful's database of venues and cities for the closest match possible. If only one venue match is found, that venue is returned. If more than one is found, the top match is returned along with a list of alternative venues. If no matches are found, a "fail" status is returned. If the location string matches a city more closely than any venues, a TBD venue in that city is returned. However, venue matches will be favored if they seem to fit more closely. For instance, "Paris" will return a TBD venue in Paris, France, and "Las Vegas" will return a TBD in that city, but "Paris Las Vegas" will return the venue ID for the Paris Hotel in Las Vegas.

param.name: location
param.doc: A venue name and/or city.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Given a user ID, returns a list of that user's calendars. Note: This method requires user authentication to list private calendars.

param.name: owner
param.doc: The Eventful username of the calendars' owner. Optional, defaults to authenticated user.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Given a calendar ID, returns the properties of that calendar. Note: This method requires user authentication to get a private calendar.

param.name: id
param.doc: The calendar ID.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Given a user ID, returns the user data associated with that user. See http://www.eventful.com/users/eventor for an example interface.

param.name: id
param.doc: The ID of the requested user.

param.name: list-counts
param.doc: List counts of user activity. Set to 1 to display this data. Optional.

method.name: GET
method.doc: This function handles user search. It performs the requested search, returning the results as an XML file.

param.name: keywords
param.doc: The search keywords.

param.name: sort_order
param.doc: Orders sorting of results by "relevance" (default), "username", "event_count", "venue_count", or "calendar_count".

param.name: count_only
param.doc: If count_only is set, an abbreviated version of the output will be returned. Only total_items and search_time elements are included in the result. Optional.

param.name: page_size
param.doc: The desired number of results per page. Optional.

param.name: page_number
param.doc: The desired page number. Optional.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Given a user ID, returns a list of all groups of which the user is member.

param.name: id
param.doc: The user ID.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Given a user ID, returns the most recent venues added by this user. See http://eventful.com/events/new (the recent venues list) for an example interface.

param.name: id
param.doc: The user ID. Defaults to the authenticated user. Optional.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Adds a new locale to a user. See user preferences for an example interface.

param.name: id
param.doc: The user ID.

param.name: locale
param.doc: The locale to add to the user.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Lists all locales attached to a user.

param.name: id
param.doc: The user ID. If not specified, the authenticated user by default. Optional.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Deletes a locale from a user. See user preferences for an example interface.

param.name: id
param.doc: The user ID from which to delete the locale.

param.name: locale
param.doc: The name of the locale to delete.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Marks a user as going to an event.

param.name: event_id
param.doc: The event ID.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Marks a user as not going to an event.

param.name: event_id
param.doc: The event ID.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Creates a new calendar. See http://eventful.com/calendars/new for an example interface.

param.name: calendar_name
param.doc: The calendar name.

param.name: description
param.doc: The calendar description. Optional.

param.name: tags
param.doc: A space-delimited list of tags. Optional.

param.name: privacy
param.doc: The privacy setting for this calendar. (1 = public, 2 = private, 3 = semi-private). Optional, defaults to 1.

param.name: where_query
param.doc: The keywords to use for smart calendar - the "what". Optional.

param.name: notify_schedule
param.doc: Choice to notify owner on updates to calendar either "immediately", "daily", or "weekly". Optional.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Given a calendar ID, returns the calendar data associated with that calendar.

param.name: id
param.doc: The ID of the requested calendar.

method.name: GET
method.doc: This function handles calendar search. It performs the requested search, returning the results as an XML file.

param.name: keywords
param.doc: The search keywords. Optional

param.name: count_only
param.doc: If count_only is set, an abbreviated version of the output will be returned. Only total_items and search_time elements are included in the result. Optional.

param.name: sort_order
param.doc: One of 'relevance', 'calendar_name'. Default is 'relevance'. Optional.

param.name: sort_direction
param.doc: One of 'ascending' or 'descending'. Default is 'ascending'. Optional.

param.name: page_size
param.doc: The desired number of results per page. Optional.

param.name: page_number
param.doc: The desired page number. Optional.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Modifies an existing calendar.

param.name: id
param.doc: The ID of the calendar object to modify.

param.name: calendar_name
param.doc: The calendar name. Optional.

param.name: description
param.doc: The calendar description. Optional.

param.name: tags
param.doc: A space-delimited list of tags. Optional.

param.name: privacy
param.doc: The privacy setting for this calendar. (1 = public, 2 = private, 3 = semi-private). Optional, defaults to 1.

param.name: where_query
param.doc: The keywords to use for smart calendar - the "what". Optional.

param.name: notify_schedule
param.doc: Choice to notify owner on updates to calendar either "immediately", "daily", or "weekly". Optional.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Permanently deletes a calendar given an id (e.g. "C0-001-000000000-1").

param.name: id
param.doc: The calendar ID to delete.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Adds an event to a calendar.

param.name: calendar_id
param.doc: The unique ID of the calendar that the event will be added to.

param.name: event_id
param.doc: The ID of the event that will be added to the calendar.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Adds an event to a calendar.

param.name: calendar_id
param.doc: The unique ID of the calendar that the event will be removed from.

param.name: event_id
param.doc: The ID of the event that will be removed.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns a list of events associated with a calendar.

param.name: id
param.doc: The calendar ID.

param.name: count_only
param.doc: If count_only is set, an abbreviated version of the output will be returned. Only total_items and events/list_time elements are included in the result. Optional.

param.name: modified_since
param.doc: Searches for events that were modified after modified_since time. In the form of yyyy-MM-ddTHH-mm-ss. (E.g. "2005-11-15T18:00:00".)

param.name: sort_order
param.doc: One of 'date', 'title', 'venue_name'. Default is 'date'. Optional.

param.name: sort_direction
param.doc: One of 'ascending' or 'descending'. Default is 'ascending'. Optional.

param.name: page_size
param.doc: The desired number of results per page. Optional.

param.name: page_number
param.doc: The desired page number. Optional.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns an iCalendar (RFC-2445) (not XML) document of events contained on a specified calendar.

param.name: id
param.doc: The calendar ID.

param.name: date
param.doc: Limit this list of results to the specified date range. Date ranges are specified by label. Currently supported labels include: "All", "Future", "Past", "Today", "Last Week", "This Week", "Next week", and months by name, e.g. "October". Optional.

param.name: sort_order
param.doc: One of 'date', 'title', 'venue_name'. Default is 'date'. Optional.

param.name: sort_direction
param.doc: One of 'ascending' or 'descending'. Default is 'ascending'. Optional.

param.name: page_size
param.doc: The desired number of results per page. Optional.

param.name: page_number
param.doc: The desired page number. Optional.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns an an RSS 2.0 (not XML) feed of events contained in a specified calendar.

param.name: id
param.doc: The ID of the calendar to use as the feed source.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Adds a property to a calendar. Properties are custom name/value pairs that can be used to add arbitrary information to a venue. For instance, a "Rating" property of "5 Stars" could be added to a venue using this method.

param.name: id
param.doc: The venue ID.

param.name: name
param.doc: The property name.

param.name: value
param.doc: The property value.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Lists all properties for a calendar.

param.name: id
param.doc: The ID of the calendar.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Removes a property (or group of properties) from a calendar.

param.name: id
param.doc: The ID of the calendar.

param.name: property_id
param.doc: The ID of the property to remove. Specify either this or "name".

param.name: name
param.doc: The name of the property to remove. NOTE: if name is specified, any property with this name will be removed from this venue. Specify either this or "id".

method.name: GET
method.doc: Adds a new group. Undocumented.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Gets the details for a group. Undocumented.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Modifies a group. Undocumented.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Withdraws (deletes) a group. Undocumented.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Searches for a group. Undocumented.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Adds a user to a group. Undocumented.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns a list of members associated with a group. See http://eventful.com/groups/G0-001-000001237-8/members for an example interface.

param.name: id
param.doc: The group ID.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Removes a user to a group. Undocumented.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Adds an event to a group.

param.name: id
param.doc: The group ID.

param.name: event_id
param.doc: The event ID.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Removes an event from a group. Undocumented.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Lists the events for a group. Undocumented.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Uploads an image to Eventful and assigns it an image ID. Use this method to upload via URL.

param.name: image_url
param.doc: The group ID.

param.name: caption
param.doc: A caption for this image. Optional.

method.name: POST
method.doc: Uploads an image to Eventful and assigns it an image ID. Use this method to upload via POST file data.

param.name: image_file
param.doc: The local filename.

param.name: caption
param.doc: A caption for this image. Optional.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Deletes an image. Undocumented.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Creates a new performer. See http://eventful.com/performers/new for an example interface.

param.name: name
param.doc: The name of this performer.

param.name: short_bio
param.doc: A short biography of this performer.

param.name: long_bio
param.doc: A detailed biography of this performer. Optional.

param.name: tags
param.doc: A space-delimited list of tags. Optional.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Given a performer ID, returns the performer data associated with that performer.

param.name: id
param.doc: The ID of the requested performer.

param.name: show_events
param.doc: If true, include the events list.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Modifies an existing performer.

param.name: id
param.doc: The ID of the performer object to modify.

param.name: name
param.doc: The name of this performer. Optional, defaults to the original name.

param.name: short_bio
param.doc: A short biography of this performer.

param.name: long_bio
param.doc: A detailed biography of this performer. Optional.

param.name: tags
param.doc: A space-delimited list of tags. Optional.

method.name: GET
method.doc: This function handles performer search. It performs the requested search, returning the results as an XML file. See the search box at http://eventful.com/performers for an example interface.

param.name: keywords
param.doc: The search keywords. Optional.

param.name: count_only
param.doc: If count_only is set, an abbreviated version of the output will be returned. Only total_items and search_time elements are included in the result. Optional.

param.name: sort_order
param.doc: One of 'relevance', 'name', 'event_count', 'demand_member_count', or 'created'. Optional.

param.name: sort_direction
param.doc: One of 'ascending' or 'descending'. Default is 'ascending'. Optional.

param.name: page_size
param.doc: The desired number of results per page. Maximum 100, defaults to 20. Optional.

param.name: page_number
param.doc: The desired page number. Optional.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Marks a performer as withdrawn. Withdrawn performers are not listed in search results.

param.name: id
param.doc: The performer ID to withdraw.

param.name: note
param.doc: A short reason why this performer was withdrawn.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Add links to a performer. Undocumented.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Remove links from a performer. Undocumented.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Add an image to a performer.

param.name: id
param.doc: The performer ID.

param.name: image_id
param.doc: The image ID. (See /images/new to upload an image and retrieve the ID.)

method.name: GET
method.doc: Removes an image from a performer.

param.name: id
param.doc: The performer ID.

param.name: image_id
param.doc: The image ID. (See /images/new to upload an image and retrieve the ID.)

method.name: GET
method.doc: Given a demand ID, returns the demand data associated with that demand.

param.name: id
param.doc: The ID of the requested demand.

method.name: GET
method.doc: This function handles demand search. It performs the requested search, returning the results as an XML file. See the search box at http://eventful.com/demand for an example interface.

param.name: keywords
param.doc: The search keywords. Optional.

param.name: location
param.doc: A location name to use in filtering the search results. Locations in the form "San Diego", "San Diego, TX", "London, United Kingdom", and "Calgary, Alberta, Canada" are accepted, as are postal codes ("92122"). Optional.

param.name: count_only
param.doc: If count_only is set, an abbreviated version of the output will be returned. Only total_items and search_time elements are included in the result. Optional.

param.name: sort_order
param.doc: One of 'relevance', 'name', 'category', 'member_count', 'performer', or 'created'. Optional.

param.name: sort_direction
param.doc: One of 'ascending' or 'descending'. Default is 'ascending'. Optional.

param.name: page_size
param.doc: The desired number of results per page. Maximum 100, defaults to 20. Optional.

param.name: page_number
param.doc: The desired page number. Optional.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Lists all event categories.
